c20f6b601913edfb.voiceContent: I gotta say, this is fantastic. Seems you really know how to live it up.

71e1d76f5279be95.voiceContent: Aha, an open-air hot spring! Hmm, judging from the amount of steam, I can reasonably infer that the water is perfect.

e472a12309df0b13.voiceContent: But the room really has a certain intrigue to it. Imagine poof, the lights go out... Bang! Bang! Bang! A knock at the door, suddenly the wardrobe starts creaking... Then you hear a faint, raspy voice coming from beneath the bed...

401bf9685c4617b2.voiceContent: When I'm soaking in a hot spring, my inspiration soars like steam rising from the hot water.

5f866f2b4a8b4b0a.voiceContent: Haha, it'd be a great setting for a murder mystery party, don't ya think?

7a1e733d95a7be7c.voiceContent: Wow, the layout and style here really are something! All that's missing is some special lighting...

91c7e64672d53a87.voiceContent: Hehe, as my partner, I knew you'd catch on. You're already thinking a step ahead before I've explained anything.

abbdd5b2d286832b.voiceContent: Well hello there, my dear partner. How have you been?

76f8488daca039e6.voiceContent: Oh â€” no no, that's my problem. Gah, look at me, making you feel bad...

70679f5b90806c85.voiceContent: Oh? Well, I guess there is one thing.

73161d7e123ba2d2.voiceContent: In that case, let me start by telling you about myself. Now, where to begin...

366faa2c25030051.voiceContent: Catching the culprit is what Detective Heizou is all about.

ad70a0d4e8d82382.voiceContent: Let's play a little game of mine!

07e1bedd179907a5.voiceContent: Here's how it works After you return here each day, I'll try to guess what you did that day, what you ate... even who you saw.

be539d5ea208463b.voiceContent: Of course, it's my hope that they can move on from the events of the case sooner rather than later and just continue on with their lives.

46e4a1737a4156f4.voiceContent: By the way, you've got that spark in you too. It's hit me a few times in our time together, I could genuinely feel it.

d30751d181d5418c.voiceContent: Haha, no no no no, you've got it all wrong. You see, I've been hanging around here for a while now.

2d2f872a766599d1.voiceContent: You look pretty worn out, get some sleep! It can be dangerous not getting enough rest, you know.

43745818aded3707.voiceContent: Oh? Using a compliment to change the subject, are we?

0845dc2531e02cae.voiceContent: Haha, don't worry. I know very well that the criminal is the one who should feel guilty.

6c76ffa0d66effde.voiceContent: Excellent question! But naturally, the answer is no. I'll leave that task of apprehending criminals to colleagues who specialize in that kind of thing.

a60cd64b758ff47b.voiceContent: You see, my intention is to just show them some care, so it's better not to reopen any old wounds.

ff05b9238342c62e.voiceContent: *yawn* Uh-oh, seems you're not the only one, I'm feeling a little tired now myself.

d7973de32f3a68ae.voiceContent: I have deduced that not all the arrangements here is based on your personal taste, no... on the contrary, some of it is intentionally done with visiting friends in mind.

f6b74d82b3a794d6.voiceContent: People have this real... glow about them when they're doing something they believe in, you know? They stand out in the world, like Flaming Flowers. And they make it a brighter place.

a486af7babb96bbf.voiceContent: You betcha. Don't let my usual rational appearance fool you. It turns out that I'm easily swayed by emotion.

24196453b8c21e32.voiceContent: Better if I just leave the items with a letter on their doorstep.

f5098f75cf09781b.voiceContent: You've already heard about who I am and who my connections are. And I'm sure you know my general likes and dislikes after all this time together...

6ac0096dd88aeed5.voiceContent: Yes. Of course, it's Detective Heizou's duty to establish the truth.

a02cdb69fe81fd45.voiceContent: That's why I strive to keep those people safe from anyone looking to take advantage. Call me crazy, but when I see something beautiful, I wanna keep it that way.

5d4304e4223de7d4.voiceContent: If I win, you'll think of something to do for me. But, if I lose, then I'll treat you to the best Kushikatsu place I know. How's that sound?

d0860862ef452584.voiceContent: Oh no, that wouldn't work out well. Tensions tend to rise the moment they see my face. There's a chance they would even start throwing punches at me.

41eb6bc8a371b65d.voiceContent: And whether it's from the more obvious details like the style and arrangement of your space, or the more subtle details like the type of decorations you've set out... Just by looking around, I've already gathered a lot of info about you.

8acfbed50ceab4c2.voiceContent: My intuition tells me that with you coming along, this will be the smoothest and most enjoyable trip yet.

e73c769678ec7f49.voiceContent: ...Hey, I have an idea! I think it'll give me a chance to redeem myself and serve as something fun to do.

05c10bea225d3c51.voiceContent: It appears you have some secrets that you'd prefer to leave unspoken.

5e6c30f5ccbe9f36.voiceContent: Hehe, thanks for looking out for me.

1a46a199ce8143e7.voiceContent: But the trip might be a little inconvenient. First, we'll have to go into town and buy a few things we'll need. After that, we'll head out of town for a while, and we'll likely need to return to the Police Station again before the day's through...

c00b93919fee0a3c.voiceContent: It was my conclusive evidence that landed their relatives in prison. If it wasn't for me, then they wouldn't be left all on their own now...

fc36037021029f18.voiceContent: Anyway, we'll leave once you're ready.

9a34ea31634094a0.voiceContent: Oh? Trying to change the subject, are we?

66fb7b8b7ff3da39.voiceContent: As for my family background, I'm guessing you're not too interested in that...

a8d88f7f57b30dca.voiceContent: After all, speaking just as plain old Heizou here, I'm a firm believer in helping those in need and being kind to other people.

b4b250346862e2d0.voiceContent: But when it comes to regrets... *sigh* I only regret that I couldn't stop the tragedy by nipping the crime in the bud.

e888785f28289820.voiceContent: With the way we understand each other, it'd be waste of time to elaborate.

710733b283d4a080.voiceContent: I was just about to head out for a bit. Care to join me, my dear partner?

024847cb87ac1ab4.voiceContent: Remember, if you ever find yourself caught up in some strange case, just notify me immediately.

4cf30506dc6ac718.voiceContent: Too bad there are no cases to crack, though... It's almost too serene. Lacks a little intrigue.

e1d82193c07093b8.voiceContent: Ah, how about this! I'll tell you my weakness.

2eefad88c18a7ecd.voiceContent: Actually, I was thinking of visiting the relatives of some convicted criminals. Some of them are elderly folks, some of them are just kids.

c62e9dfb6f9684a3.voiceContent: For now, while the criminals are serving their time at correctional facilities, I'll help look after their families.

f3c12f5ac8009b6b.voiceContent: Shh! That's my weakness, okay? So be sure to keep this one top-secret.

957fffb96cf0c0a3.voiceContent: Sure, of course! I've actually been waiting to give you a taste of the old Heizou treatment.

243ffb63a949556c.voiceContent: Hehe... seriously, if you've got a moment, I'd love to hear all the details.

ceb05efe990ae499.voiceContent: But no need to worry, I'd say the peace and quiet you have here makes it an even better vacation spot than Watatsumi Island.

59549fdaebda93b7.voiceContent: As for what led me to this conclusion...

38fa2b66e25747f2.voiceContent: But once the case is solved, the criminal's family are the ones who will face public ridicule and discrimination.

e0abe5511149a924.voiceContent: Uh-oh! We got too close and he noticed us!

984aea361b3da40c.voiceContent: Oh, it's all coming out now!

ad2ae6250e7606da.voiceContent: Hmph, I'm liking the look of this!

649417d1def8ce33.voiceContent: That's it, I'm taking this case over.

724f31d0f147c347.voiceContent: Got a problem you can't solve? Clue me in.

1ca40fda7019b0be.voiceContent: Let's move before the trail goes cold.

bec54a7e02efd0fc.voiceContent: The name's Shikanoin Heizou, sharpest and most successful detective of the Tenryou Commission... Ooh, my goodness, life's really put you through the wringer recently, hasn't it? I can tell. Here, why don't you take a seat, tell me the whole story.

c025f958a7a665b2.voiceContent: There's something in the air... something that tells me a new case is brewing.

f1ebd75f9dda0c95.voiceContent: Doing detective work means you gotta walk the walk. No... I mean literally â€” I need to search high and low for evidence.

6c929d67de296d04.voiceContent: Huh, my intuition tells me that something very interesting is about to happen...

d81d71147323e8a1.voiceContent: Let's just hope the rain hasn't washed all the clues away.

834e7d507e68e667.voiceContent: Hmm... I wonder which criminal mastermind just protested their innocence in court... A liar by the sounds of it. Hehe.

ac8df9063d0be57b.voiceContent: Have you ever heard of the case of the vengeful spirit of Dragonspine? It all happened on a dark, snowy night long ago...

93a0f513d487f062.voiceContent: Heh, it's gonna take a little more wind than that to form a cyclone!

d1e9aca2f425ca96.voiceContent: Morning. Oh my, you don't look so good. You didn't have a nightmare, did you? *sigh* I should've known not to expose you to such a shocking case so soon.

faa9db9601ba9192.voiceContent: Alright. Now that lunch is over, whaddya say we play a game to keep our minds sharp? Relay Stones? Hehe... okay, I guess we can warm up with that.

7bdcc17124789fdc.voiceContent: Once the sun has clocked out for the day, it's up to the stars to keep criminals under their watchful gaze.

ef2c9b57414ff374.voiceContent: Great, it's time to hit the hay! I wonder what dreams await me tonight?

0dd56ac4b8a3457b.voiceContent: A detective should be using their smarts to crush criminals' hopes of getting away with their crimes. So really, a true detective should never even have to touch their weapon.

5371295dd48b9165.voiceContent: I've made it a habit of mine to remember everything I observe in the form of keywords. They're a big help to me when I'm trying to make deductions. Take this person for example we've got cat hair on clean trousers, and scratch on the wrist. Looks like they have a soft spot for animals, but they can't get cats to reciprocate... Meanwhile, that one seems very troubled about their injured hand, and they're wearing a pair of brand-new shoes that don't match their well-worn attire... Hold on, it looks like I might have a new case on my hands here!

d1958b293d74c584.voiceContent: Coincidence is a nice word. It makes things sound like they were meant to be. Unfortunately, as a detective, I don't believe in coincidences. The two of us meeting each other is really the culmination of every choice and move we've made up to this point. So what I'm saying is... our destiny is something we choose.

4022b044d10b9b49.voiceContent: Seems to me like these commissions of yours are an endless gold mine of cases, and you'll never be able to finish them all. So maybe you could throw one my way every once in a while? Not the ones that involve fighting, running errands, or searching for lost items â€” as you know, not my style. I only take on big, important cases with lots of mysteries to solve... So, keep an eye out for me, yeah? Hehe.

38410e011be4d663.voiceContent: Oh? So there are rumors that I can overpower my Tenryou colleagues without even using my Vision? Hehe, well, let me set the record straight. One Although I am technically a Doushin, I'm strictly a detective. My mind is my greatest tool, not my muscles. Two It's not like my colleagues and I are getting into fights with each other all the time. And three... *sigh* Alright, seems like there's no fooling you. Just... never mind then, okay?

d365c60ba3751254.voiceContent: As you piece together the trail of clues, it brings you closer and closer to the culprit... and then, that moment when you finally put the last piece of the puzzle into place... I always get such a sense of accomplishment. It's exhilarating!

a4a4833a0659e0ee.voiceContent: Question, Traveler, how much do you know about timber? That's right, I'm talking about wood from any ordinary tree you might find along the roadside. Whether a criminal bumps into the bark, disturbs a pile of sawdust, or treads on some leaves, the chances are, they're always gonna leave a trace somehow. Add to that some knowledge of which trees grow in what areas, and if you're lucky, you can infer some crucial details. So, you know trees. They're a sleuth's best friend.

43156a7d79654138.voiceContent: Madam Kujou Sara? Yeah, that lady's gotta be the most serious person in the entire Tenryou Commission. It would be nice if she could cut us a little slack and give everyone some breathing room â€” and she's always on my case about my occasional unexplained absences, but what can I say... I just go wherever the evidence leads me.

79800ec72ec9fc9b.voiceContent: I've done a few favors before to deliver Roasted Lavender Melon to him in prison. This one time, I overheard him singing. The lyrics... were complete trash, but I gotta say â€” he has a pretty good set of pipes. And it's not every day you come across an inmate who's in the mood to sing their heart out.

08a47a41181ee9bf.voiceContent: The Arataki Gang is a free and diverse organization that accepts anyone, regardless of their background. Pretty amazing if you ask me. They're lucky to have Shinobu to help keep them all in line. Hmm? How do I know all this? Haha, I mean... as deductions go, this one was pretty elementary.

e5893572a48bd48b.voiceContent: General Gorou's constant suspicion made my trip to Watatsumi Island much more eventful... Everywhere I went, there were soldiers keeping me under close surveillance. Honestly, I was a regular, boring tourist just like everybody else. So what if I happen to be a detective in my day job? I was clearly minding my own business there.

7432717e7c93b90d.voiceContent: I've actually never seen Madam Sangonomiya before. Whenever she appears, practically the whole village crowds around her... I'm not about to contend with that. Oh, and even if you made it through all the villagers, there'd still be a circle of shrine maidens around her! For one of us young people to gain that kind of recognition from everyone, it must have taken a lot of work.

7a93525001fec21a.voiceContent: I'm barely acquainted with the daughter of the Kamisato Clan. I'm glad that I'm not from some sort of prestigious family like that... it's definitely not the kind of life for me.

3a1c8d6a71524a56.voiceContent: Come to think of it, Lady Guuji's publishing house also publishes murder mysteries, right? So... when can you introduce me? In this day and age, becoming a famous detective requires more than just ability â€” you need publicity, too. Huh? C'mon, I'm being serious here!

dd9cbb8cd556ddd5.voiceContent: Oh, Kazuha? Yeah, he's a solid guy. With his help, I felt like a locked treasure chest of clues had been bust wide open and emptied all over the ground for me to see. If only I had his sensitivity to the natural world... Oh, I get it now! The wind to him must be like my intuition to me!

abd6dd85df2336f2.voiceContent: Ohh... It's such a pity! Since the Vision Hunt Decree's been repealed, I no longer have any grounds to officially arrest him. But then again... I guess now, I can just openly invite him to come to the Tenryou Commission and discuss cases with me.

513d1aebf9c6cc06.voiceContent: Even if someone chooses to remain absolutely silent, you can still learn a lot about them just by observing their clothes, posture, and facial expressions. Now, if this conversation ended here... what could you gather from my appearance alone?

c18148f4c6131269.voiceContent: Once, when I was sitting in on a criminal trial, I suddenly realized I'd cracked the case. So I interrupted the court just as they were about to declare the verdict. If my objection had turned out to be invalid, then that moment wouldn't have been the turning point that saw me become a detective. Instead, it would have been... Shikanoin Heizou, I hereby find you in contempt of court and order your immediate detention! Hahaha!

686f2efe42003128.voiceContent: Investigating extramarital affairs, tracking down runaway pets... Those are pretty much the only cases you'll find at a detective agency. I personally need cases of a higher caliber... so, obviously, my only option was to jump ship and join the Tenryou Commission. Another factor was that Sango and I didn't quite see eye to eye in a lot of areas... Just one of those things, I guess.

2234fcc2d2ae26db.voiceContent: When I first joined the Tenryou Commission, I started honing my craft by reviewing some cold cases. Before I knew it, Mt. Coldcase had been completely leveled... It is a pity, these days I no longer have the time to go back and look through old files. I'm forever being brought in to help out on the toughest cases, and I barely have a moment to catch my breath in between jobs... Well, what can you do. Once you're a detective of this caliber, the cases come to you.

a0408acb15de9d92.voiceContent: By the time a detective is facing a criminal, they have in some sense already failed. Whatever you might do to establish the truth and identify the culprit, you'll never be able to undo the damage caused by the crime. That's why I want my reputation to spread. I want to be a famous detective that makes would-be criminals quake in their boots and quit while they're ahead! In other words, I want to nip crime in the bud. Well, now that you've heard my spiel, why don't you lend me a hand?

a9ee4ee2af78f3c2.voiceContent: Would you like to sit in on a court trial at the Tenryou Commission some time? It's like watching the truth slowly emerge as a collage of facts is pieced together... I can save you a really good seat, but we'll have to pretend like we don't know each other... You know, just pretend.

f6e876708e4f4257.voiceContent: There are always those people who resort to violence at the very last second, as if that'll somehow solve their problems. It's a real bummer. Victory for me is to see the look on the defendant's face as they finally confess to their crime in the face of my ironclad evidence and watertight deductions... The moment a detective has to use brute force, they've already lost.

c9addcc1dfc6ae37.voiceContent: I cannot stand dinner at the Police Station. It's always the same regimented meals, and don't even get me started on the taste. When it comes to food, you can't enjoy it unless you get to pick exactly what you want, right? But nope, poor me has to make do with slipping out and grabbing a quick bite. *sigh*

35669963b3f9f092.voiceContent: Mmm, I love it! You really outdid yourself this time. Well done!

491464bb2ace2e38.voiceContent: Would you say cooking is more of a physical or a cognitive task? Hmm, I believe it's both... No wonder you're such a good cook!

508bfb25d37f011c.voiceContent: Hurk! Mmm... let me think. Where did you go wrong here...

7181a5111e52a621.voiceContent: After I learned that today was your birthday, there was a brief moment when I really wanted to take you to a locked room chock-full of mechanisms and gifts, where you could only get out by solving all the puzzles... Hehe, it's actually really fun! You know, of course I wouldn't do anything like that unless I was sure you'd actually enjoy it. Here, come with me. There's this beautiful scenic spot I've gotta show you before the sun goes down.

32e1a3b95fe0dab1.voiceContent: As I get stronger, my intuition gets sharper!

ac9455aff5db888e.voiceContent: It appears my combat abilities are advancing. Too bad it's not all cognitive.

2e51b7a7b27bb397.voiceContent: My, my! At this rate, the name Cyclone is really gonna stick, isn't it...

0028e9a0bf5a93ec.voiceContent: Thanks for your trust and support, my dear partner. I couldn't have made it this far without your help. Hmm... I suppose we have time for a quick high five, but then let's get back out there and solve some more mysteries!

54ba95579c155f55.voiceContent: Ugh, if that's how you want it...

a84e29486592b6bb.voiceContent: This is no job for a detective...

fc72565dadd131db.voiceContent: Name me one item of food that doesn't taste better deep-fried. You can't, right? Whether it's meat or veggies, as long as it's been pulled out of the fryer, I'll love it! I don't think anyone with an empty stomach can resist the smell of fried food.

7cdb53f2ee4f7acb.voiceContent: Not only does being a Doushin come with a certain amount of prestige, it also puts me closer to the action on some of the toughest cases, so the position has definitely broadened my horizons compared to when I was at the detective agency. As for the other duties â€” patrolling, apprehending criminals, and so on â€” obviously, I leave that to the more... qualified individuals. There's a limit to how much a single detective can do, you know.

ae458341ace5b6ca.voiceContent: You don't want to do this.

70a209c9cc4e3c2f.voiceContent: Hurk! Mmm... let me think. Where did you go wrong here...

cbd89966b064be31.voiceContent: Would you say cooking is more of a physical or a cognitive task? Hmm, I believe it's both... No wonder you're such a good cook!

1f6f9d2223c59087.voiceContent: Mmm, I love it! You really outdid yourself this time. Well done!
